Bradford – Girlington Library to close: may move into community centre.
Hampshire – Mobile library service could be lost (£360k cut). £500k from £2m bookfund to be spent on refurbishing libraries to make them "modern and vibrant" until 2020 then that £500k will be lost.
Bournemouth – £250k cut: Ensbury Park Library may close, moving services into Learning Centre.
West Berkshire – Burghfield Common Library to close. One of two mobile libraries to close. £90k cut
Greenwich – Abbey Wood Library to moved into new building in Cross Quarter.
Cornwall – Confirmed many libraries will either be passed to parish/town councils or closed.
Lincolnshire – Crowland Library reopens as volunteer-run.
Suffolk – Needham Market Library may move into redundant school to co-locate with internet café and museum group.
Glasgow – Job losses and funding cut. Libraries, learning and community teams combined.

Norfolk – £920 spent on technology to allow unstaffed libraries to be open, Millennium Library to be reduced by 2 hours opening per day, £300,000 per year reduction in bookfund (from £1.353m), 1 mobile out of 8 to be lost,

Rhondda Cynon Taf – £327k cut: Reduction in number of librarians, branch library opening hours reduced to 31.5 hours per week, single staffing introduced at 5 libraries (Hirwaun, Ferndale, Pontyclun, Mountain Ash, Rhydyfelin), 25% cut to bookfund, 1 out of 4 mobile libraries to be lost, magazines/newspapers reduced, part-time Community Learning Worker lost.
Ceredigion – Llandysul library and 2 mobiles will be closed and one other library under threat.
Hertfordshire – Chorleywood now volunteer-run and volunteer staffed, council covers maintenance, stock, IT and some staffing support.

Coventry – Plan to close all libraries except five hubs abandoned: instead £558k cut p.a: Mobile library to end (£85k cut p.a.), all libraries except Central will close on Wednesdays, Central will close one hour earlier on weekdays, Arena Library will move (£300k cut p.a.), Willenhall will also move (£48k cut p.a.), £100k cut to book/materials fund p.a.
Hampshire – Considering Open+ remote control libraries in some branches. 4 libraries under threat.
Herefordshire – Hereford Central Library needs £1 million due to asbestos: library closed since September. Temporary library will open November 24th.
Somerset – Spending freeze on non-essential library spending imposed.
Lincolnshire – Burgh Le Marsh now volunteer.
Nottinghamshire – Libraries become part of non-profit trust Inspire (along with archives and culture).
Denbighshire – Rhyl Library co-located with One Stop Shop.

Essex – Adult fiction/non-fiction at £784k (2014/15) with children fiction/non-fiction at £511k (increased from £258k previous year). Number of FTE staff down from 355.8 in 2012-13 to 324.8 in 2014-15. 1 mobile lost (from 11 down to 10 serving 579 stops) (Source: FOI request).
Greenwich – Mobile library may close, with users being offered tablet PCs instead.
Lambeth – Upper Norwood Library Trust appeal for £80k funds to address shortfall due to cuts from Croydon and Lambeth.
Cardiff – Rumney Library closed, moves into Partnership Hub, staffed by volunteers.
Isle of Man – Henry Bloom Noble Library moves into old Top Shop, changes opening hours.
Brighton and Hove – £1 million cut by end 2017/18.
Clackmannanshire – 34% cut in bookfund over last four years (second biggest decrease in Scotland).
Neath and Port Talbot – Skewen and Baglan libraries may close.
East Ayrshire – 35% increase in bookfund over last four years (biggest increase in Scotland)
North Lanarkshire – Bookfund decreased by 41% in last four years (biggest decrease in Scotland). Small (£23k) investment in e-books.
East Lothian – 33% cut in bookfund over last four years (third biggest decrease in Scotland) but council claims this is due to bolstered bookfund for new library at start of this period.
Suffolk – 30% cut ("efficiency savings") since 2012 almost complete. Council has asked for a further 11% cut 2016/18 (£700k).
Worcestershire – Bromsgrove Library reopens in co-located building: £6.9m jointly between county and borough council.
